titlestmt.subtitle: An inventory of the collection at Syracuse University
titlestmt.author: unknown

did.head: Overview of the Collection
did.unittitle: Folio Society Collection
did.abstract: Correspondence with authors, editors, and artists; original artwork; unbound galleys for FOLIO 21: A bibliography of The Folio Society 1947-1967
did.langmaterial: Most in English, a few items in French.

bioghist.head: Biographical History
bioghist.p: The Folio Society is a privately owned London-based publisher, founded by Charles Ede, Christopher Sandford, and Alan Bott in 1947. It produces illustrated hardback editions of classic fiction and non-fiction books, poetry and children's titles. For many years the Society also operated a bookstore in the Holborn area of London, but it closed in 2016.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents of the Collection
scopecontent.p: The Folio Society Collection consists of correspondence with authors, editors, and illustrators, as well as numerous pieces of original art including wood block prints, lithographs, and sketches. Notable correspondents include Cecil Beaton, Walter de la Mare, Daphne du Maurier, Derrick Harris, Joan Hassall, Gerard Hopkins, B.H. Liddell Hart, Harold Nicolson, Laurence Olivier, Herbert Beerbohm Tree, and Cicely Veronica Wedgwood.

The material is arranged by Folio Society publication number, although not all Folio Society publications are represented, and in some cases correspondence or artwork pertaining to one publication may be filed under another title due to context. The Society's own bibliography, a copy of which is in the collection, was used to determine dates. Under each publication are listed the names of the correspondents and/or artists represented in that folder. In addition, a complete Index to the collection is provided at the end of this finding aid.

arrangement.head: Arrangement of the Collection
arrangement.p: By Folio Society publication number (FS 1, FS 2, etc.), according to the Society's bibliography.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Material
relatedmaterial.p: &scrc_name; also has a large collection of more than 350 Folio Society editions. Please refer to &summitref; to locate these items.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: The majority of our archival and manuscript collections are housed offsite and require advanced notice for retrieval. Researchers are encouraged to contact us in advance concerning the collection material they wish to access for their research.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p: Written permission must be obtained from SCRC and all relevant rights holders before publishing quotations, excerpts or images from any materials in this collection.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Preferred citation for this material is as follows:
